  physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a man. Only his head and upper torso are captured in the photograph. He is wearing his ethnic costume
 with piping that runs down the collar to the right side. He wears a tasselled headdress as well. He is not looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured.

  subject_terms_1: men (male humans) black-and-white photographs studio portraits folk costume

  sgcool_label_text: This carte de visite shows a young man with a tasselled headdress. The studio mark ‘R. Shultz’ is imprinted at the bottom of the carte. \r\n\r\nStudios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s
 Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.

metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a man. Only his head and upper torso are captured in the photograph. He is wearing his ethnic costume, with piping that runs down the collar to the right side. He wears a tasselled headdress as well. He is not looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This carte de visite shows a young man with a tasselled headdress. The studio mark ‘R. Shultz’ is imprinted at the bottom of the carte. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
